Class MainMenuController

    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class MainMenuController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The main menu screen that displays the scheduled appointments.

      • OAAddAppointment

        public void OAAddAppointment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Add appointment window loader. AddAppointment loads the add new appointment screen over the main menu screen.
        Parameters:
        event - A UI button on the screen.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - A thrown exception if the scene is unable to be loaded.

      • OACustomers

        public void OACustomers​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Customer screen loader. Customers loads the customer page replacing the main menu page.
        Parameters:
        event - A UI button on screen.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - A thrown exception if the scene is unable to be loaded.

      • OADeleteAppointment

        public void OADeleteAppointment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Delete appointment. Uses the DBQuery class to delete a appointment on the program and the database after checking if the User is sure they want to. Uses the selected appointment's ID to use the SQL query to delete the appointment. If deletion is completed a warning will display to inform the user. If deletion fails due to database connection a warning is displayed informing the user. A warning is displayed if no appointment is selected.
        Parameters:
        event - a UI button on the screen.

      • OALogout

        public void OALogout​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
              throws java.io.IOException
        User Logout. Logs the user out and loads the Log in page again. OA stands for On Action
        Parameters:
        event - a UI button.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - a thrown exception if the scene is unable to be loaded.

      • OAMonthView

        public void OAMonthView​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Monthly appointment view. Shows only the appointments in the current month.
        Parameters:
        event - a UI button on the screen.

      • OADefault

        public void OADefault​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Default appointment view. Returns the displayed appointments to the default view.
        Parameters:
        event - a UI button on the screen.

      • OAReports

        public void OAReports​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Report screen loader. Loads the Reports page, replacing the main menu screen.
        Parameters:
        event - A UI button on screen.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - a thrown exception if the scene is unable to be loaded.

      • OAUpdateAppointment

        public void OAUpdateAppointment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Update appointment screen loader. Receives the onscreen selected appointment and populates the Update appointment screen that loads over the main menu screen. Uses a SQL Query to load the database appointment to avoid error in loading an incorrect version of a appointment. Throws a error message if there is no appointment selected.
        Parameters:
        event - A UI button on the screen that requires a selected appointment.

      • OAWeekView

        public void OAWeekView​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Weekly appointment view. Shows only the appointments for the next 7 days.
        Parameters:
        event - A UI button on the screen.

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        Initializes the main menu page and 15 min appointment alert. Loads the allAppointments ObservableArrayList from the Appointments class and populates the table with each appointment as a row. Upon initialization the controller, checks if an appointment is starting in 15 minutes and shows a warning screen with the clients details if there is an appointment. If no appointment is scheduled within 15 minutes a display is shown.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - The location of the resources to initialize.
        resourceBundle - program resource bundle for initialization.
